school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

awards.title: Hedera MVP
awards.description:
What does it take to become an MVP?

Contribute
MVPs have demonstrated their ability to provide relevant insights into the fast-moving world of web 3.0. Whether training new developers, speaking at conferences, or writing blog posts – helping educate is key to a Hedera MVP.
Share
MVPs are key enablers for those new to Hedera or seasoned veterans. Answering questions in Discord, Stack overflow, Telegram, etc., are keyways to scale our collective understanding, and help promote the welcoming community Hedera is proud to have.

projects.title: Summerschool South Korea - Smart Cities: State of the Practice, State of the Art
projects.description: The Summer School is a part of the Business Informatics Master’s Program at Utrecht University. Every year a group of bright students lead by experienced researchers investigate an open topic in the ICT domain. They go beyond deskresearch visiting companies around the world to discover the current trends, challenges, best practices and solutions.

projects.title: JADS - Just Another Data Scientist
projects.description:
One day, three guys met in a University Lab in Utrecht. One of them is doing a Phd in Utrecht University on data science (for medical), the other is a data scientist in a food/nutrition company (Danone), the 3rd guy is a former data analyst from the biggest energy compnay(Shell).
On one hand, companies are hiring a lot of data scientists and trying to push the data-driven mind in the company. On the other hand, we all noticed that there are people doing data science in a very wrong way =.=. We already have a lot data scientist tutorials and blogs, they are all brilliant. And I learnt a lot from them as well.
However, we did notice that most of the blogs and tutorials are very limited in replication or hard to implement. Most importantly, the goal/value to read those blogs is to learn and use it in our own practice. Therefore, we three try to make a balance among:
Algorithm:
Who don’t just let you copy our code and run it, wow, it works, but then what? We will explain the algorithm (it’s very technical, but don’t be scared, we will make sure you understand.)
Implementation
We don’t just talk algorithm, it’s important though. A end-to-end implementation will be introduced and most importantly, code will be shared :-) We even host off-line talks to explain and help you do the hands-on! Come and talk with us.
Use cases
Algorithm and implementation are important, but without a attractive use case and data, it’s boring, isn’t it? We scan the web, write our own web crawler to get the data if necessary. Playing data with A LOT OF FUN is important :-P

profile_positions.title: CEO/Product Lead

profile_positions.description: As one of the top 15 global startups in batch 6 (out of hundreds applications), we are working closely with F10 and its corporate members (Generali, Baloise, etc) to redefine the insurance and mobility industry with a Insurance++ platform. Providing a more engaged, transparent and automated insurance + mobility experience for customers.
profile_positions.title: Startup Things Protocol

profile_positions.description: Appreciate the support from Shell and the best line manager, Shell IT CTO: Johan Krebbers ;-)
profile_positions.title: Sabbatical - Try something BIG

profile_positions.description:
Reporting directly to Shell IT CTO/Innovation VP to identify, assess and test the most advanced cutting-edge technologies. 

Leading projects: 
- Shell Global IoT Service 1.0, super low-cost remote monitoring (project won the Shell VP CIO award in Q3 2019)
- Shell IoT for manufacturing sites (LoRaWAN&NBIOT)
- IoT platform evaluation project with AWS and Microsoft
- Slack Project with PTSOM
- Nano-Satellite for IoT monitoring (hiber.global)
- IoT Device Hub project on Github

- Speaker at IoT Tech Expo Amsterdam 2019

Interested areas: 
- Blockchain
- IoT
profile_positions.title: IT CTO Advisor - Emerging digital technology and innovation

profile_positions.description:
As a data analytics analyst, I am focusing on various of project/use cases in Shell. Actively engaging with the business stakeholders and engineers, to understand the business problems, and propose a data analytics solution. 

- Project I am leading: 
Shell Predictive Assets Maintenance V1
- Projects I am involved in: 
QGC well equipment predictive maintenance; 
cash flow from operation prediction; 
Geomatics text analytics of NAM

I am using Alteryx, Spotfire, Python and machine learning technics to unlock the value of the data and create the predictive models for forecasting.
profile_positions.title: Data Analytics Analyst - Data science team for Upstream, Integrated Gas & New Energy Business

profile_positions.description: I worked with a dedicated team of people in different locations, with different expertise and cultures, on the enhancement management project. The new process I proposed went LIVE and is being used by Shell staffs across the world. Besides this project, I also helped our manager to work on CIO's strategic priorities project to engage with various senior people from Upstream, DownStream, P&T, TaCIT and Global Function.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst - Functional Excellence team in IT operation and service for Shell global business

profile_positions.description: My professor and I did a big consultancy assignment for them. Our main task is helping Huawei to analyze the app store ecosystem and improve their Vmall (Huawei's app store) and developer community.
profile_positions.title: Research in Utrecht University

profile_positions.description:
I researched the possibilities of building a Utrecht-China Alumni group, to be managed by the Department of Marketing and Communication of Utrecht University. Our goal is to build several small -- but strong -- alumni chapters in China. We would like to study the benefits of such chapters to  the alumni, Utrecht University and companies in Utrecht. In turn, we also hope to benefit universities and companies in China.

In the summer of 2014, the first Utrecht University China Alumni meeting was successfully held in Beijing by me and my colleague. Opinions were exchanged between the alumni and the University. Based on that, a future alumni strategy is under development
profile_positions.title: Assistant of Alumni relations

volunteer_experiences.description: Invited by Utrecht University international alumni office, I attended several career mix with students studying in various programs. Alumni office connected several students with me for further conversation, and I played a role as their career mentor to help them shape their career development plan. So far I have coached 5 students.

It is a programme offered by InfoNepal.org in Nepal. I worked in a monastery in Kathmandu. My job was teaching the little lamas English, math and "play" with them. The life in Nepal opened a new sight for my life. "Enter to grow in wisdom, depart to serve better thy country and thy kind". This is what I found in Harvard University, but I believe we should not only serve our own country, but also serve the one who needs us.

The Global Citizen Festival is one of the super musical festival aims to end injustice and inequality in the world. I worked as a volunteer event staff to provide the concert audiences with useful information and maintain the order.
